verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH3068>, when the Lord would take up<WH5927> Elijah<WH452> into heaven<WH8064> by a whirlwind<WH5591>, that Elijah<WH452> went<WH3212> with Elisha<WH477> from Gilgal<WH1537>.

And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Stay<WH3427> here<WH3068>, I pray you; for the Lord has sent<WH7971> me to Beth<WH1008>–el. And Elisha<WH477> said<WH559> unto him<WH3068>, As the Lord lives<WH2416>, and as your soul<WH5315> lives<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> you<WH3381>. So they went down to Beth<WH1008>–el.

And the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> that were at Beth<WH1008>–el came forth<WH3318> to Elisha<WH477>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Know you that the Lord<WH3068> will take away<WH3947> your master<WH113> from your head<WH7218> to day<WH3117>? And he said<WH559>, Yes<WH3045>, I know it<WH2814>; hold you your peace.

And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto him<WH477>, Elisha, stay<WH3427> here<WH3068>, I pray you; for the Lord has sent<WH7971> me to Jericho<WH3405>. And he said<WH559>, As the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, and as your soul<WH5315> lives<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> you<WH935>. So they came to Jericho<WH3405>.

And the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> that were at Jericho<WH3405> came<WH5066> to Elisha<WH477>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Know you that the Lord<WH3068> will take away<WH3947> your master<WH113> from your head<WH7218> to day<WH3117>? And he answered<WH559>, Yes<WH3045>, I know it<WH2814>; hold you your peace.

And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto him<WH3427>, Stay, I pray you<WH3068>, here; for the Lord has sent<WH7971> me to Jordan<WH3383>. And he said<WH559>, As the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, and as your soul<WH5315> lives<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> you<WH8147>. And they two went on<WH3212>.
And fifty<WH2572> men<WH376> of the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> went<WH1980>, and stood<WH5975> to view<WH5048> afar off<WH7350>: and they two<WH8147> stood<WH5975> by Jordan<WH3383>.

And Elijah<WH452> took<WH3947> his mantle<WH155>, and wrapped it together<WH1563>, and struck<WH5221> the waters<WH4325>, and they were divided<WH2673> here and there<WH8147>, so that they two went over<WH5674> on dry ground<WH2724>.

And it came to pass<WH5674>, when they were gone over, that Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Ask<WH7592> what I shall do<WH6213> for you<WH3947>, before I be taken away from you<WH477>. And Elisha said<WH559>, I pray you<WH8147>, let a double portion<WH6310> of your spirit be upon me<WH7307>.
And he said<WH559>, You have asked<WH7592> a hard thing<WH7185>: nevertheless<WH7200>, if you see me when I am taken from you<WH3947>, it shall be so unto you; but if not, it shall not be so.

And it came to pass<WH1980>, as they still went on<WH1980>, and talked<WH1696>, that<WH7393>, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire<WH784>, and horses<WH5483> of fire<WH784>, and parted<WH6504> them both<WH8147> asunder<WH996>; and Elijah<WH452> went up<WH5927> by a whirlwind<WH5591> into heaven<WH8064>.

And Elisha<WH477> saw<WH7200> it<WH6817>, and he cried, My father<WH1>, my father<WH1>, the chariot<WH7393> of Israel<WH3478>, and the horsemen<WH6571> there<WH7200>. And he saw him no more<WH2388>: and he took hold of his own clothes<WH899>, and tore<WH7167> them in two<WH8147> pieces<WH7168>.
He took up<WH7311> also the mantle<WH155> of Elijah<WH452> that fell<WH5307> from him<WH7725>, and went back, and stood<WH5975> by the bank<WH8193> of Jordan<WH3383>;

And he took<WH3947> the mantle<WH155> of Elijah<WH452> that fell<WH5307> from him<WH5221>, and struck the waters<WH4325>, and said<WH559>, Where is the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Elijah<WH452>? and when he also had struck<WH5221> the waters<WH4325>, they parted<WH2673> here and there<WH477>: and Elisha went over<WH5674>.

And when the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> which were to view at Jericho<WH3405> saw<WH7200> him<WH559>, they said, The spirit<WH7307> of Elijah<WH452> does rest<WH5117> on Elisha<WH477>. And they came<WH935> to meet<WH7125> him<WH7812>, and bowed themselves to the ground before him<WH776>.

And they said<WH559> unto him<WH3426>, Behold now, there be with your servants<WH5650> fifty<WH2572> strong<WH2428> men<WH1121>; let them go<WH3212>, we pray you<WH1245>, and seek your master<WH113>: lest perhaps the Spirit<WH7307> of the Lord<WH3068> has taken him up<WH5375>, and cast<WH7993> him upon some<WH259> mountain<WH2022>, or into some<WH259> valley<WH1516>. And he said<WH559>, You shall not send<WH7971>.

And when they urged<WH6484> him until he was ashamed<WH954>, he said<WH559>, Send<WH7971>. They sent<WH7971> therefore fifty<WH2572> men<WH376>; and they sought<WH1245> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>, but found him not<WH4672>.
And when they came again<WH7725> to him<WH3427>, (for he stayed at Jericho<WH3405>,) he said<WH559> unto them<WH559>, Did I not say unto you<WH3212>, Go not?

And the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Behold<WH4186>, I pray you, the situation of this city<WH5892> is pleasant<WH2896>, as my lord<WH113> sees<WH7200>: but the water<WH4325> is naught<WH7451>, and the ground<WH776> childless<WH7921>.
And he said<WH559>, Bring<WH3947> me a new<WH2319> jar<WH6746>, and put<WH7760> salt<WH4417> in it<WH3947>. And they brought it to him.

And he went forth<WH3318> unto the spring<WH4161> of the waters<WH4325>, and cast<WH7993> the salt<WH4417> in there<WH559>, and said, Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, I have healed<WH7495> these waters<WH4325>; there shall not be from there any more death<WH4194> or childless land<WH7921>.
So the waters<WH4325> were healed<WH7495> unto this day<WH3117>, according to the saying<WH1697> of Elisha<WH477> which he spoke<WH1696>.

And he went up<WH5927> from there unto Beth<WH1008>–el: and as he was going up<WH5927> by the way<WH1870>, there came forth<WH3318> little<WH6996> sons<WH5288> out of the city<WH5892>, and mocked<WH7046> him<WH559>, and said unto him<WH5927>, Go up, you bald head<WH7142>; go up<WH5927>, you bald head<WH7142>.

And he turned<WH6437> back<WH310>, and looked<WH7200> on them<WH7043>, and cursed them in the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068>. And there came forth<WH3318> two<WH8147> she bears<WH1677> out of the wood<WH3293>, and tore<WH1234> forty<WH705> and two<WH8147> sons of them<WH3206>.
And he went<WH3212> from there to mountain<WH2022> Carmel<WH3760>, and from there he returned<WH7725> to Samaria<WH8111>.
